## Conversation that answers the provided questions:
**User:**
Hey, I've been hearing a lot about Verus Mobile. Can you tell me more about its key features and benefits, particularly with regards to its integration with VerusID and the Verus Authentication Protocol?

**AI Assistant:**
Verus Mobile is indeed an exciting development. With its recent update, it now supports VerusID, a self-sovereign identity system that enables users to manage their digital identities in a decentralized manner. This integration brings a host of benefits and features to the table.

With Verus Mobile, users can send and receive funds, as well as use their VerusID as a password-free, secure, and self-sovereign sign-in for web and mobile applications. This is made possible by the VerusID authentication protocol, which enables application provisioning of IDs. This means that applications can onboard users, provide them with a verified self-sovereign ID and funds address, and enable sending and receiving payments. This makes applications more secure by design with an easy, password-free sign-in.

In addition to its support for VerusID, Verus Mobile also includes Wyre as a fiat on-ramp and maintains support for Bitcoin, Ethereum, and a variety of popular coins and tokens. This makes it a comprehensive mobile application for managing digital assets and identities.

For app developers, Verus Mobile provides an opportunity to integrate VerusID authentication into their mobile or web applications, enabling a more user-centric, inherently commerce-enabled, and verifiable application model. This can help to create a true Internet of Value, where users have full control over their digital identities and assets.

Overall, the integration of VerusID and the Verus Authentication Protocol into Verus Mobile provides a significant leap forward in terms of security, usability, and functionality, and has the potential to revolutionize the way we interact with digital applications and services.

Introducing VerusID to Verus Mobile
This version of Verus Mobile takes a major leap forward, enabling support for VerusID, including sending and receiving funds and use of your VerusID as a password-free, secure and self-sovereign web or mobile app sign-in, made possible with the VerusID authentication protocol.
Verus Mobile v0.3.0–24 supports the version 1.0 of the VerusID authentication protocol, which prepares for the PBaaS upgrade and supports application provisioning of IDs, an important way applications can onboard users, give them a verified self-sovereign ID and funds address, enable sending and receiving payments, and make applications more secure by design with an easy, password-free sign-in.
In addition to its new support for VerusID and the Verus Authentication Protocol, this version of Verus Mobile continues to include Wyre as a fiat on-ramp and maintains support for Bitcoin, Ethereum, and a variety of popular coins and tokens.
If you are an app developer who wants to benefit from and help pioneer a better, more user-centric, inherently commerce-enabled, verifiable application model for a true Internet of Value, this is the release that enables you! If you’ve got mobile or web applications that you are seriously building and would like to integrate VerusID authentication, contact one of the community developers for more details.
